definitions.definition: A user-adjustable three-terminal variable resistor that can be used as a voltage divider.
An instrument that measures a voltage by opposing it with a precise fraction of a known voltage, and without drawing current from the unknown source.

main_definition: ( electronics ) A user-adjustable three-terminal variable resistor that can be used as a voltage divider.
secondary_definitions: ( physics ) An instrument that measures a voltage by opposing it with a precise fraction of a known voltage, and without drawing current from the unknown source. [from late 19th c.]
